title: How I Use Helium, KDSpy, and Publisher Rocket to Select GREAT Keywords for Children's Books/ Amazon!

tactics.name: Reverse ASIN Lookup
tactics.description: Use Helium's Cerebro tool to analyze top-performing books in a niche by inputting their ASINs and extracting keywords.
steps: Identify top-selling books in the niche (e.g., anti-bullying for middle schoolers).
Extract ASINs and input them into Helium's reverse ASIN lookup.
Filter keywords by search volume (minimum 500/month) and competition levels.
caveats: Some keywords may have high search volume but also high competition
source_quotes: I want a minimum of 500 searches a month... lower competition

tactics.name: Keyword Revenue Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword potential using monthly revenue and competition data from Publisher Rocket
steps: Check monthly revenue and sales numbers
Compare Kindle vs print book performance
Analyze word clouds for common keywords
source_quotes: we already know that it's great with regard to competition we could see that in the other tool in the helium there's not a lot of competitors out there using this term right potential it says caution the revenue potential of books under this keyword looks a little average

tactics.name: Competitor Thresholds
tactics.description: Set maximum competing products and searches per month for keyword selection
source_quotes: i limited it to 600 competing products because... keep it around 500

tactics.name: Category Export
tactics.description: Extract competitor categories for niche alignment
source_quotes: copy these categories... fit with your book

tactics.name: category_competition_analysis
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify low-competition categories and export keyword lists for Amazon ads
steps: Export competition data from Publisher Rocket
Perform keyword searches with specific phrases
Export and test keyword lists in Amazon ads
caveats: When keyword data fails to show clear competition trends
source_quotes: it's the absolute best out there tool for finding really great categories

heuristics.name: Keyword Filtering Rule
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume and low competition, prioritize it
source_quotes: I want the magic of high volume searches lower competition

heuristics.name: Cerebro Score Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200 then boost keyword
source_quotes: the higher the score the better the perceived value of that keyword

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Boost
source_quotes: i usually like to keep it around 500

heuristics.name: low_competition_boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200 and BSR below 50,000, prioritize this category
source_quotes: if you find those categories that have less competition

claims.statement: Helium's Cerebro tool provides a list of keywords associated with a given ASIN
source_quotes: This reverse ASIN lookup does within helium

claims.statement: Average monthly revenue for anti-bullying print books is $10,000
source_quotes: average monthly revenue on the print side these books make about ten thousand dollars a month

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket enables competitor category analysis
Publisher Rocket helps identify low-competition categories for becoming a best-selling author
source_quotes: it's the absolute best out there tool for finding really great categories

niche_patterns.description: Focus on specific audience needs within a niche with underserved markets
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Targets precise pain points with lower competition
source_quotes: Empowering kids to stand up to others this is juicebox bully
